unnormalised: Mr. Rakesh Sharma has been appointed as the new CFO of Tata Steel, effective 01/10/2024. The announcement was made earlier today by the company's board of directors. Mr. Sharma brings over 20 years of experience in finance and accounting to the role, having previously served as the VP of Finance at Infosys. His expertise is expected to be instrumental in driving Tata Steel's financial strategy and growth initiatives.
normalised: Mister Rakesh Sharma has been appointed as the new C-F-O of Tata Steel, effective first October two thousand and twenty four. The announcement was made earlier today by the company's board of directors. Mister Sharma brings over twenty years of experience in finance and accounting to the role, having previously served as the V-P of Finance at Infosys. His expertise is expected to be instrumental in driving Tata Steel's financial strategy and growth initiatives.

unnormalised: Prior to Infosys, Mr. Sharma held leadership positions at leading multinational corporations, including a stint as Sr. Director at Wipro. His appointment comes at a critical time for the steel industry, which is facing increasing global competition and fluctuating market conditions. Analysts believe that Mr. Sharma's financial acumen will be a valuable asset to Tata Steel as it navigates these challenges.

unnormalised: Ms. Priya Desai, the current CEO of Tata Steel, expressed her confidence in Mr. Sharma's abilities. “We are delighted to welcome Mr. Sharma to Tata Steel,” she stated. “His extensive experience and proven track record make him the ideal candidate to lead our finance function. We look forward to his contributions in achieving our strategic objectives and delivering value to our shareholders." The board will hold an introductory press conference on 05/10/2024 at 11:00 AM IST.
